templates.template: AWS ECS Serverless Cluster by HTTP
templates.name: AWS ECS Serverless Cluster by HTTP
templates.description:
The template gets AWS ECS Serverless Cluster metrics and uses the script item to make HTTP requests to the CloudWatch API.
Don't forget to read the README.md for the correct setup of the template.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

triggers.expression: length(last(/AWS ECS Serverless Cluster by HTTP/aws.ecs.alarms.check))>0
triggers.name: Failed to get alarms data

items.name: Container Instance Count
items.description: 'The number of EC2 instances running the Amazon ECS agent that are registered with a cluster.'

triggers.name: High CPU utilization
triggers.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

items.name: Ephemeral Storage Reserved
items.description:
'The number of bytes reserved from ephemeral storage in the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using. Ephemeral storage is used for the container root filesystem and any bind mount host volumes defined in the container image and task definition. The amount of ephemeral storage can’t be changed in a running task.
 This metric is only available for tasks that run on Fargate Linux platform version 1.4.0 or later.'

items.name: Ephemeral Storage Utilized
items.description:
'The number of bytes used from ephemeral storage in the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using. Ephemeral storage is used for the container root filesystem and any bind mount host volumes defined in the container image and task definition. The amount of ephemeral storage can’t be changed in a running task.
 This metric is only available for tasks that run on Fargate Linux platform version 1.4.0 or later.'

items.name: Get alarms data
items.description:
Get alarms data.
DescribeAlarms API method: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeAlarms.html

items.name: Get cluster services
items.description:
Get cluster services.
Full metrics list related to ECS: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/userguide/metrics-dimensions.html

items.name: Get cluster metrics
items.description:
Get cluster metrics.
Full metrics list related to ECS: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/userguide/metrics-dimensions.html

items.name: Memory Utilization
items.description:
'The memory being used by tasks in the resource that is specified by the dimension set that you're using.
 This metric is only collected for tasks that have a defined memory reservation in their task definition.'

triggers.name: High memory utilization
triggers.description: The system is running out of free memory.

triggers.expression: length(last(/AWS ECS Serverless Cluster by HTTP/aws.ecs.metrics.check))>0
triggers.name: Failed to get metrics data

items.name: Network rx bytes
items.description:
'The number of bytes received by the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using.
 This metric is only available for containers in tasks using the awsvpc or bridge network modes.'

items.name: Network tx bytes
items.description:
'The number of bytes transmitted by the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using.
 This metric is only available for containers in tasks using the awsvpc or bridge network modes.'

items.name: Service Count
items.description: 'The number of services in the cluster.'

items.name: Task Count
items.description: 'The number of tasks running in the cluster.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#ALARM_NAME}]: Get metrics
item_prototypes.description: Get alarm metrics about the state and its reason.

item_prototypes.name: [{#ALARM_NAME}]: State
[{#ALARM_NAME}]: State reason

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/AWS ECS Serverless Cluster by HTTP/aws.ecs.alarm.state["{#ALARM_NAME}"])=2 and length(last(/AWS ECS Serverless Cluster by HTTP/aws.ecs.alarm.state_reason["{#ALARM_NAME}"]))>0
trigger_prototypes.name: [{#ALARM_NAME}] has 'Alarm' state

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: CPU Utilization
item_prototypes.description:
"A number of CPU units used by tasks in the resource that is specified by the dimension set that you're using.
 This metric is only collected for tasks that have a defined CPU reservation in their task definition."

trigger_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototypes.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: CPU Reserved
item_prototypes.description:
"A number of CPU units reserved by tasks in the resource that is specified by the dimension set that you're using.
 This metric is only collected for tasks that have a defined CPU reservation in their task definition."

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Desired Task
item_prototypes.description: The desired number of tasks for an {#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME} service.

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Ephemeral storage reserved
item_prototypes.description:
'The number of bytes reserved from ephemeral storage in the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using. Ephemeral storage is used for the container root filesystem and any bind mount host volumes defined in the container image and task definition. The amount of ephemeral storage can’t be changed in a running task.
This metric is only available for tasks that run on Fargate Linux platform version 1.4.0 or later.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Ephemeral storage utilized
item_prototypes.description:
'The number of bytes used from ephemeral storage in the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using. Ephemeral storage is used for the container root filesystem and any bind mount host volumes defined in the container image and task definition. The amount of ephemeral storage can’t be changed in a running task.
This metric is only available for tasks that run on Fargate Linux platform version 1.4.0 or later.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Get metrics
item_prototypes.description:
Get metrics of ESC services.
Full metrics list related to ECS : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ecs/index.html

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Memory utilization
item_prototypes.description:
'The memory being used by tasks in the resource that is specified by the dimension set that you're using.
This metric is only collected for tasks that have a defined memory reservation in their task definition.'

trigger_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: High memory utilization
trigger_prototypes.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Memory reserved
item_prototypes.description:
'The memory that is reserved by tasks in the resource that is specified by the dimension set that you're using.
This metric is only collected for tasks that have a defined memory reservation in their task definition.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Memory utilized
item_prototypes.description:
'The memory being used by tasks in the resource that is specified by the dimension set that you're using.
This metric is only collected for tasks that have a defined memory reservation in their task definition.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Network rx bytes
item_prototypes.description:
'The number of bytes received by the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using.
This metric is only available for containers in tasks using the awsvpc or bridge network modes.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Network tx bytes
item_prototypes.description:
'The number of bytes transmitted by the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using.
This metric is only available for containers in tasks using the awsvpc or bridge network modes.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Pending Task
item_prototypes.description: The number of tasks currently in the `pending` state.

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Running Task
item_prototypes.description: The number of tasks currently in the `running` state.

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Storage read bytes
item_prototypes.description: 'The number of bytes read from storage in the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Storage write bytes
item_prototypes.description: 'The number of bytes written to storage in the resource that is specified by the dimensions that you're using.'

item_prototypes.name: [{#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME}]: Task Set
item_prototypes.description: The number of task sets in the {#AWS.ECS.SERVICE.NAME} service.

macros.description: Authorization method. Possible values: role_base, access_key.
The warning threshold of the cluster CPU utilization expressed in %.
The warning threshold of the cluster memory utilization expressed in %.
The warning threshold of the cluster service CPU utilization expressed in %.
The warning threshold of the cluster service memory utilization expressed in %.
Filter of discoverable alarms by name.
Filter to exclude discovered alarms by name.
Filter of discoverable alarms by namespace.
Filter to exclude discovered alarms by namespace.
Filter of discoverable services by name.
Filter to exclude discovered services by name.
Sets HTTP proxy value. If this macro is empty then no proxy is used.
